title: Actor Charles Grodin dies at 86
description: Charles Grodin, a versatile comedic actor best known for his roles in movies like "Midnight Run" and "The Heartbreak Kid," died Tuesday at his home in Connecticut, after battling cancer, according to his son.

title: The choice every Republican politician must now make
Hear what Republicans are saying about Kevin McCarthy's move
description: CNN's Jamie Gangel reports on why House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy announced that he's opposing an inquiry to investigate the January 6 attack on the Capitol.

title: Andrew Giuliani announces bid to run for governor of New York in 2022
description: Andrew Giuliani, son of former New York mayor Rudy Giuliani, has announced his candidacy for governor of New York in 2022, he told CNN on Tuesday.

title: Thousands of Palestinian protesters gathered in towns in the West Bank as hostilities resumed after a brief lull
description: Israel and the Palestinian territories were bracing for a potentially tense day of protests and strikes Tuesday, as both sides prepare to bury the victims of the deadliest violence the region has seen in years.

title: See Biden floor it in electric Ford pickup truck
description: President Joe Biden took an electric Ford pickup truck for a test drive after speaking to auto workers in Deerborn, Michigan.

title: Biden takes new electric F-150 for a test drive: 'This sucker's quick'
description: It's not every day an American president gets to speed down a driving course in an electric pick-up truck trailed by Secret Service. But on Tuesday, President Joe Biden did just that.

title: Biden dodges question on Israel with a joke
description: President Biden declines to take a question by a reporter regarding Israel at a Ford event in Michigan.

title: Half the world's single-use plastic waste produced by just 20 companies
description: Production of single-use plastics is set to grow 30% in the next five years, fueling their contribution to global warming and ocean pollution, researchers said Tuesday as they published a list of companies that manufacture and fund throwaway plastic.

title: Arab-Israeli lawmaker calls Israeli action in Jerusalem 'ethnic cleansing'
description: CNN's Bianna Golodryga talks with Arab-Israeli lawmaker Aida Touma Suleiman about the ongoing Israeli-Palestinian conflict as Israeli warplanes continue to pound Gaza, and Palestinian protesters hit the streets in cities across the West Bank and elsewhere.

title: Thailand reports highest number of daily Covid deaths as virus tears through prisons
Thousands of migrants swim from Morocco to Spanish enclave
description: At least 6,000 people, including around 1,500 minors, swam from Morocco to the bordering Spanish enclave of Ceuta on Monday in the largest influx of illegal migration there in a single day, Spanish authorities said.

title: Prophetic investor from 'The Big Short' is betting against Tesla
description: Michael Burry, one of the investors who became famous for predicting the epic collapse in the housing market in 2008 that was chronicled in the book and movie "The Big Short," has a new favorite stock to bet against: Tesla.

title: Famous Galapagos rock formation collapses
description: One of the most famous rock formations in the Galapagos Islands has collapsed into the sea.

title: 'They aren't moving on': Keilar presses Rev. Graham on election claims
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar spars with Rev. Franklin Graham over misinformation disseminated following the 2020 president election.

title: Ethiopian soldiers armed with guns and grenades raid hospital featured in CNN report
description: Ethiopian soldiers armed with machine guns, sniper rifles and grenades raided a hospital in Ethiopia's war-torn northern Tigray region earlier this week in retribution, doctors say, for a CNN investigation that revealed Ethiopian and Eritrean troops were blocking humanitarian aid to patients there.

title: Body-cam video in shooting of Andrew Brown Jr. shown to public for the first time
description: District Attorney Andrew Womble said that the deputies who fatally shot Andrew Brown Jr. last month were justified in using deadly force, saying Brown "recklessly" drove at the officers on scene. Several body-camera videos shown to the public for the first time showed ​from when deputies arrived until they removed Brown from his car.

title: Drew Barrymore on Woody Allen: I was 'gaslit'
description: Drew Barrymore recounts her experience working with Woody Allen and how having kids changed her outlook on the famed director who's been accused of sexually abusing his young daughter.

title: Fifth suspect arrested in connection with castle art heist
description: A fifth suspect has been arrested in connection with the audacious heist in which around 100 of Europe's most priceless treasures were stolen from the Green Vault at Dresden Castle in Germany.

title: Naomi Campbell welcomes her first child in surprise Instagram post
description: Supermodel Naomi Campbell has welcomed her first child, announcing the unexpected birth Tuesday on social media. A representative for Campbell confirmed the news.

title: Nick Jonas is recovering from bike accident
description: Singer/actor and recently returned "The Voice" coach Nick Jonas has revealed details following reports he was hospitalized over the weekend.

title: Nick Jonas returns to 'The Voice' after bike accident
description: Nick Jonas spoke about injuries he received from a recent bike accident during the semifinal round broadcast of 'The Voice."

title: Hundreds evacuated after record-setting rainfall
description: Parts of Louisiana got over a foot of water in one day, setting a record in the area. Hundreds have been evacuated and more rain is on the way.

title: What Joe Biden's tax returns should remind us of (HINT: Donald Trump)
description: On Monday night, President Joe Biden did something relatively unremarkable: he released his 2020 tax returns, showing that he and his wife, Dr. Jill Biden, had made just over $607,000 in the last year and owed federal taxes of $157,000.

title: Oil companies given a dramatic warning
description: The International Energy Agency, which was founded by rich industrial nations after oil shocks in the 1970s to promote secure and affordable energy supplies, says the world needs to stop drilling for oil and gas right now to prevent a climate catastrophe.

title: Ariana Grande secretly marries her fiancé
description: Singer Ariana Grande tied the knot with fiancé Dalton Gomez in a small ceremony at her California home, according to a statement from a Grande representative.

title: Authorities face big challenges at Arizona border. Here's why
description: CNN's Jim Sciutto takes a deeper look at the challenges authorities are facing with smuggling at the Arizona border.

title: Walmart got a boost from shoppers spending their stimulus checks
description: The latest round of federal stimulus payments of up to $1,400 per person lifted sales at Walmart, the largest retailer in the United States, as shoppers used their checks to buy clothing, home goods and other merchandise at stores and online.

title: Prince Harry and Oprah Winfrey discuss mental health in new series trailer
description: Prince Harry has spoken about mental health in the trailer for an Apple TV+ documentary series with Oprah Winfrey, which aims to destigmatize the topic.

title: Police search café for possible victim of serial killer
description: Police in the UK will carry out excavation work at a café linked to infamous serial killer Fred West after reports of "possible evidence" that a body is buried there.

title: Emma Watson sets the record straight on work and love life
description: Even though Emma Watson has almost 60 million followers on Instagram and almost 30 million on Twitter, she hasn't posted since last June and last August respectively.

title: Foxconn's electric car ambitions just got another boost with Stellantis deal
description: Foxconn is partnering with automaker Stellantis to develop technology for vehicle cockpits, in the latest sign of the iPhone maker's ambitions to grow in electric car manufacturing.

title: Inspirational Asian American sites you can visit
description: Nearly every week, it seems there's a new disturbing video or news report of attacks on Asian Americans or Pacific Islanders in the United States.

title: Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher open the doors to their stunning barn-inspired home
description: A 10-foot-tall crystal chandelier and a set of custom-made silver thrones might not scream "contemporary farmhouse." But Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher have somehow made them feel at home in their opulent yet rustic hilltop house in Los Angeles.

title: Surfer dies after being bitten by shark in Australia
description: A surfer has died after a suspected shark attack at a popular beach in New South Wales (NSW), Australia.

title: Transgender women allowed to play women's rugby in France
description: The French rugby federation (FFR) has voted unanimously in favor of allowing transgender women to play women's rugby as of next season.

title: India lashed by strongest cyclone to ever hit west coast as it reels from Covid disaster
description: India was slammed on Monday by the strongest storm on record to reach its west coast, hampering  authorities' response to the Covid-19 crisis in some of the country's hardest hit regions.

title: Video shows storm hitting India as battle against Covid continues
description: India has been hit by the strongest storm on record to reach its west coast, hampering authorities' response to the Covid-19 crisis in some of the country's hardest hit regions. CNN's Anna Coren has more.

title: Ex-astronaut shares tips on how to readjust after months of isolation
description: In countries lucky enough to have advanced vaccine programs, we must adapt again: To crowds, conversations, and a pace of life that can seem distant and intimidating. CNN's Phil Black speaks to people who have some experience readjusting from extreme isolation.

title: Amazon reportedly in talks to buy MGM
description: Amazon is reportedly in talks to buy MGM, the vaunted film studio that was a staple of Hollywood's Golden Age. A tie-up would give the tech firm a big brand to wield as competition in streaming grows fiercer by the day.

title: Arbitrator rules Fury must face Wilder, jeopardizing Joshua fight - reports
description: A big money heavyweight fight between British champion Tyson Fury and compatriot Anthony Joshua was thrown into doubt on Monday after an American arbitrator ordered Fury to face American Deontay Wilder, according to media reports.

title: 'I can't control God,' Venus Williams tells umpire
description: Venus Williams received some unwanted divine intervention during Monday's defeat to Anna Karolina Schmiedlova, after she was given a time violation while waiting for heavy winds to die down before serving.

title: Every Lamborghini will have an electric motor by 2024
description: By the end of 2024, every model Lamborghini offers will be a plug-in hybrid, announced CEO Stephan Winkelmann. But don't expect a fully electric Lamborghini supercar anytime soon.

title: Titanic replica now under construction in China
description: For those who have always wondered what it would've been like to be a passenger on the Titanic, a theme park in China is set to offer the closest experience one can get.

title: Some athletes are comparing Nike's new running shoes to doping. Here's why
description: He might not be sponsored by Nike anymore, but US distance runner Mason Ferlic is still rocking their shoes.

title: Solar Orbiter mission spots sun eruption
description: A happy accident has resulted in the Solar Orbiter mission spying eruptions from the sun. These eruptions, called coronal mass ejections, blast out solar particles across the solar system and have the potential to disrupt technology if they reach Earth.

title: Leaked video shows dark money group bragging about restricting voter access
description: CNN has obtained video of the executive director of Heritage Action for America, a dark money group, bragging about the group ghost-writing many of the bills helping to suppress votes across the nation.

title: Artist's 138-foot-tall hot air balloon will fly over major world cities
description: He has appeared in the foothills of Mount Fuji and in the middle of downtown Taipei. His reclining figure has even floated placidly on Seoul's Seokchon Lake and in Hong Kong's famous Victoria Harbour.

title: Watch self-driving car struggle to understand traffic cones
description: An autonomous Waymo car carrying a passenger got confused when it encountered construction cones and unexpectedly drove off when the roadside support arrived.
